content: DBS Vickers Securities ETF Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Mar 2019If I DCA $200 monthly into snp500 with e.g. Vickers, does that means the $25 will be charged monthly? (Meaning only $175 goes into snp500) ?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Yes, because the minimum commission is $25.1 comment1
Hariz Arthur Maloy11 Mar 2019Damn, that's a lot.

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 11 Mar 2019If you are doing it manually via a brokerage platform, then yes, commission fees will be eating into your manual DCA plan.You could save up a lump sum and do it once a year. Or you can try a roboadvisor.0 comments1
